reviews.text:
As bad as years ago! New and old staff seems somehow untrained, quite unprofessional, and above all lazy and rude... to not say quite bullying and racist too!
Still the worst library in Hackney, in my opinion too!
Hopefully, some librarians there will change my mind sooner than later, but it is unlikely having knowing some of them for years, and not having seen much improvement yet!
PS Plenty of nicer libraries not too far from there jumping on a bus!
Just a pity, in a nice area like Stokey/Church Street now is we still get a rough service like if we were in a rough neighbourhood.
Stokey and Hackney were two different boroughs in the past, and so should be seen again nowadays, imo!
Did you know Hackney libraries' computers do not even let us delete cookies and history just assuming we live in a bad poor borough (Hackney not Stokey) so we - most likely - must be bad or poor or both, especially if seen in a public library?!
PS And don't try to reserve a new book or some new incompetents there may laugh at you saying that libraries are not bookshops, ha!
Actually, you can make reservations/suggestions of new books or Dvds to be bought!

It’s a decent library - I joined for my young daughter, and we were given a free bag with a few baby books in which was lovely. It’s great that kids are allowed to take 30 books out - we’ll definitely make use of that as she gets older. There are baby change facilities but sadly not accessible - you have to go up 3 steps to get them - far from ideal with a pram. There are also disabled toilets but those in a wheelchair would have to use the stair lift to get up to them as similarly, there are stairs in the way!  A couple of ramps could address both of these accessibility obstacles. Stars knocked off for this.

In this place, There is plenty of good material, music , movies and books , good lighting , the people who work here are usually nice,but unfortunately the average user of this library is far from behave as he/her is supposed to behave in this kind of facility. I can say this place it is not a nursery ( in my knowledge , maybe I am wrong) and should not be used in that way, people should speak a little bit less louder and be more respectful of person who are using ( or at least trying!) the library for reading/ learning purposes. I just see people around acting like this library is a park with a roof, parents who are touring children around without any intention to take a book/ movie / or  studying and most important even trying to keep their children quiet in any sort of way.  A library is a library. I was not able today of carry out any of my duties because of noise mostly caused by children and people so I decided to move to the near park so at least I was able to join a bit of sun.

I like this library. At the present moment it's not in full operation. The staff are friendly and helpful. Their children section is always active and appeals to parents with children especially after school. It is a bonding time for them and a greater way of interacting with each other. It is an open space on one level floor that easily access all the other areas in the library including dedicated security and toilet facilities.

No toilets apart from mother and baby change or disabled which we aren’t allowed to use. Me and my friend who are A level students came in to revise recently. There was no space on the main seating area but we were told we were not allowed to sit in the kids area and were instructed to move when we did (even though technically we are children). We were then confined to a small table in the ‘teens’ section which is clearly only fit for one person. This is so illogical - fix up stokey library.

address: 184 Stoke Newington Church St, London N16 0JL, United Kingdom
